title: Chest Pain - 55-Year-Old Male
dispatch: You are dispatched to a private residence for a 55-year-old male experiencing chest pain.
general_impression: Patient is seated on the couch, pale and diaphoretic. He appears anxious but alert.

behavior.on_contact: Patient says, 'It just hit me out of nowhere while I was watching TV.'

opqrst.onset: Sudden while watching TV about 20 minutes ago
opqrst.provocation: Does not worsen or improve with movement or breathing
opqrst.time: Started 20 minutes ago and has been constant

sample.signs_symptoms: Chest pain, nausea, shortness of breath
sample.events: Was sitting on the couch watching TV when pain started

instructions: Ensure the test taker performs a proper scene size-up.
Prompt the test taker to ask about the patient's SAMPLE history.
Provide additional details as needed based on the test taker's actions.

responses.ask_about_pain: The patient describes the pain as pressure-like and tight.
responses.ask_about_onset: The patient says the pain started suddenly while watching TV.
responses.ask_about_meds: The patient reports taking Lisinopril, Nitroglycerin, and Atorvastatin for hypertension and high cholesterol.
